required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease in Non Smokers:Role of Oxidative Stress

brief_summary.textblock: Background:Striking feature of Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) is its inability to resolve after cigarette smoke exposure has ended, which has contributed to the possibility that the disease could also be driven by other endogenous causes, such as autoimmunity or chronic infection . Many of the pathogenetic pathways involved in COPD and its development tend to be driven by oxidative stress.

primary_outcome.measure: oxidative stress markers in non smokers COPD compared to healthy control
primary_outcome.description: markers of oxidative stress , Superoxide Dismutase (SOD) and Malondialdehyde (MDA) by ( ELISA Kit SinoGeneClon Biotech Co.,Ltd Catalog No : SG- 10188) .

clinical_study.condition: Role of Oxidative Stress in COPD

arm_group.description: Fourty subjects of COPD who are non-smokers or stopped smoking for more than 6 months
Thirty subjects of non smokers healthy control

intervention.description: markers of oxidative stress , Superoxide Dismutase (SOD) and Malondialdehyde (MDA) by ( ELISA Kit SinoGeneClon Biotech Co.,Ltd Catalog No : SG- 10188) .

study_pop.textblock: Forty subjects of COPD who are non-smokers or stopped smoking for more than 6 months Based on the Global Initiative for Chronic Obstructive Lung Disease guidelines, COPD was diagnosed.9 2- Thirty subjects of non smokers healthy control

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 1-Forty subjects of COPD who are non-smokers or stopped smoking for more than 6 months Based on the Global Initiative for Chronic Obstructive Lung Disease guidelines, COPD was diagnosed.9 2- Thirty subjects of non smokers healthy control
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients of:
1. Acute exacerbation, at the time of the study, of COPD.
2. Any obvious abnormal lung parenchymal lesions.
3. Lung cancer.
4. Congestive heart failure.
5. current smokers
6. Drugs e.g anti-inflammatory , steroids ,analgesics, insulin , antineoplastic, antipsychotic drugs in the previous 2 weeks before the study.

responsible_party.investigator_title: principle investigator ,faculty of medicine,department of chest diseases,Minia University
